src: solver API

class src.solver.Customer(id, name='', idCustomer=<built-in function id>, penalty=0, serviceTime=0, twBegin=0, twEnd=0, demand=0, incompatibleVehicles=[])

Bases: Point

class src.solver.Depot(id, name='', cost=0, serviceTime=0, twBegin=0, twEnd=0, capacity=0, incompatibleVehicles=[])

Bases: Point

class src.solver.Link(name='', isDirected=False, startPointId=0, endPointId=0, distance=0.0, time=0.0, fixedCost=0.0)

Bases: object

Define a link of graph.

Additional informations:

isDirected —- it’s equal to True if we cannot return at startPoint with the same time and distance

property distance
property endPointId
property fixedCost
get_Link(debug=False)

Get all components of a Link which are different of default value

property isDirected
property name
property startPointId
property time
class src.solver.LinksDict

Bases: MutableMapping, dict

Dictionary of links

key (str): name of link value: class Customer or Depot

values() → an object providing a view on D's values
exception src.solver.ModelError(code=0)

Bases: Exception

Exception raised for errors in the model.

Attributes:

message – explanation of the error

class src.solver.Parameters(timeLimit=300, upperBound=1000000, heuristicUsed=False, timeLimitHeuristic=20, configFile='', solverName='CLP', printLevel=-1, action='solve', cplexPath='')

Bases: object

Define a point of graph(customer or depot).

Additional informations:

timeLimit(int) —- It can represent the limit time of resolution upperBound(float) –indicates the cost we want to reach configFile(str) – indicates the path of the config file for

more advanced settings

solverName(str) – indicates the solver used during the resolution,

we can choose “CLP” or “CPLEX” solver

printLevel(int) – indicates the level of print from Bapcod

during the resolution, we can choose (-2,-1,0)

action(str) – indicates if we want to solve the problem (“solve”)

or enumerate all feasible routes(“enumAllFeasibleRoutes”)

property action
property configFile
property cplexPath
get_Parameters(debug=False)
property heuristicUsed
property printLevel
property solverName
property timeLimit
property timeLimitHeuristic
property upperBound
class src.solver.Point(id, name='', idCustomer=0, penaltyOrCost=0.0, serviceTime=0, twBegin=0, twEnd=0, demandOrCapacity=0, incompatibleVehicles=[])

Bases: object

Define a point of graph(customer or depot).

Additional informations:
serviceTime – It can represent the time of

loading or unloading.

penaltyOrCost – if the point is a customer

we can specify penalty for not visiting the customer

—————- otherwise, if the point is a depot we can

specify a cost to using the depot

twBegin – time windows begin twEnd – time windows end incompatibleVehicles – id of vehicles that cannot deliver

the customer or not accepted in a depot

property capacity
property cost
property demand
property demandOrCapacity

property timeWindows
property twBegin
property twEnd
class src.solver.PointsDict

Bases: MutableMapping, dict

Dictionary of points ( depots and customers)

key (int): Id of point value: class Customer or Depot

values() → an object providing a view on D's values

class src.solver.VehicleType(id: int, startPointId: int, endPointId: int, name='', capacity=0, fixedCost=0.0, varCostDist=0.0, varCostTime=0.0, maxNumber=1, twBegin=0, twEnd=0)

Bases: object

Define a vehicle type with different attributes.

Additional informations:

maxNumber —- number of vehicles available varCostDist – variable cost per unit of distance varCostTime – variable cost per unit of time twBegin – time windows begin twEnd – time windows end

property capacity
property endPointId

class src.solver.VehicleTypesDict

Bases: MutableMapping, dict

Dictionary of vehicle types

key (int): Id of vehicle type value: class Vehicle type

values() → an object providing a view on D's values
class src.solver.create_model

Bases: object

Define a routing model.

Additional informations:

map_model(dict) – contains the model in json format vehicleTypes(dict) – contains the set of vehicle types points(dict) – contains the set of customers and depots links(dict) – contains the set of links output(str) – defines the json output after solving the problem

add_Customer(id, name='', idCustomer=0, serviceTime=0.0, penalty=0.0, twBegin=0.0, twEnd=0.0, demand=0, incompatibleVehicles=[])

Add Customer in dictionary self.points , id must be between 0 and 1022 and all id must be different

add_Depot(id, name='', serviceTime=0.0, cost=0.0, twBegin=0.0, twEnd=0.0, capacity=0, incompatibleVehicles=[])

Add Depot in dictionary self.points

add_Link(name='', isDirected=False, startPointId=0, endPointId=0, distance=0.0, time=0.0, fixedCost=0.0)

Add Link in dictionary self.links

add_Point(id, name='', idCustomer=0, serviceTime=0.0, penaltyOrCost=0.0, twBegin=0.0, twEnd=0.0, demandOrCapacity=0, incompatibleVehicles=[])

Add Point in dictionary self.points, if we want to add Depot idCustomer must be equal to 0 otherwise it cannot be superior to 1022 for a Customer

add_VehicleType(id: int, startPointId: int, endPointId: int, name='', capacity=0, fixedCost=0.0, varCostDist=0.0, varCostTime=0.0, maxNumber=1, twBegin=0.0, twEnd=0.0)

Add VehicleType in dictionary self.vehicleTypes

delete_Customer(id: int)

Delete a customer by giving his id

delete_Depot(id: int)

Delete a depot by giving his id

delete_Link(id: int)

Delete a link by giving his id

delete_VehicleType(id: int)

Delete a vehicle type by giving his id

export(name='instance')

Export model for debugging model, we can specify the name of file

property links
property parameters
property points
set_Model()

Set model in json format with all properties of model

set_Parameters(timeLimit=300, upperBound=1000000, heuristicUsed=False, timeLimitHeuristic=20, configFile='', solverName='CLP', printLevel=-1, action='solve', cplexPath='')

Set parameters of model. For more advanced parameters please indicates a configuration file on configFile variable. solverName : [CLP,CPLEX] action : [solve,enumAllFeasibleRoutes], printLevel = [-2,-1,0,1,2]

solve()
Solve the routing problem by using the shared library

bapcod and fill the solution.

Additional informations:

VRPSolverEasy is compatible with Windows 64x, Linux and macOS only

solve_literature_instances(instanceName='')

Resolve literature instances of CVRPTW (“Solomon” format) by giving the name of instance in input

property vehicleTypes
src.solver.main()
